segments.text: I see the woman so engrossed in her task of drying the dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost funny how she doesn’t notice the water pouring over the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window bathes the kitchen in a warm glow, almost serene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, right below her, the floor is turning into a little pond.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And I can’t help but wonder how she can be so oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children, on the other hand, are quite the little rebels.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I watch as the boy precariously balances on that stool, reaching for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Each moment feels like it could end in chaos, and I’m not even sure how they got here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl stands with her arm raised, like she’s conducting an orchestra of mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the anticipation on her face, and it makes me smile a little.
segments.speaker: PAR
